articles.title: Economic Survey calls for e-Way bill revamp in next phase of GST reform

This aims to deregulate the logistics ecosystem, cutting costs and delays for trade while maintaining effective tax oversight.

articles.title: What researchers are learning as they drill into Antarctica's 'Doomsday Glacier'
articles.summary: An expedition to Antarctica has brought scientists and researchers to the widest glacier on Earth. The Thwaites Glacier is nicknamed the Doomsday Glacier because of its potential impact on sea levels if ice continues to melt. Miles O'Brien reports on the work to drill into the ice to record temperatures and understand the impact of climate change. It's part of our series, Tipping Point.

articles.title: Ancient grain storage tradition fading fast in Srikakulam district
articles.summary: The ancestral practice known as Khoni or Paathara was once observed by farmers along the banks of the Mahendratanaya River. Several factors—including lack of space and awareness, as well as changes in rural architecture—have contributed to its decline. This tradition thrived in the inland, hilly terrain, where underground grain storage was effective. Over time, however, this ancient practice has gradually faded, becoming more of a story from the past, writes T. Appala Naidu.

articles.title: Oil prices may stay supported as Russian supply remains off market: Energy Aspects
articles.summary: Energy Aspects co-founder Amrita Sen said that Indian refiners are reducing Russian purchases, while supply disruptions and rising gas prices are tightening global energy markets. Sen said Venezuelan crude could partly offset India’s lower Russian imports, and refinery margins remain stable at current oil prices.

articles.summary: The IRS tax season is here, and so is the uncertainty around refunds. This comes as Washington is edging closer to a potential government shutdown

articles.summary: The India-EU FTA includes a clause to gradually reduce import duty on cars to 10% from 70%-110% at present, which benefits Mercedes-Benz, BMW and VW's Audi.

articles.title: JK Cement ramps up capacity with commissioning of Bihar grinding unit
articles.summary: JK Cement commissions a 3 MnTPA grinding unit at JK Cement Works in Buxar, Bihar, boosting its eastern India presence and raising total grey cement capacity to 31.26 MnTPA. Shares of JK Cement ended lower on Thursday, January 29, by 2.13% at ₹5,550.00 on the NSE.

articles.title: Macro View: Indian economy to grow steadily, but risks loom, says Economic Survey
articles.summary: India's economy is set for robust growth. Projections show a medium-term expansion of around 6.5 percent. This could climb to 7-8 percent with continued reforms. Strong domestic demand and foreign exchange reserves bolster India's resilience. The nation remains a fast-growing major economy. Global risks are present, but India is positioned for stability.

articles.title: Bond market watches Budget borrowing as yields hit 6.7%
articles.summary: Ahead of the Union Budget, experts Suyash Choudhary of Bandhan AMC and Abhishek Upadhyay of ICICI Securities PD analyse the state of India's bond market. Choudhary argues the market is stable due to RBI's support but sees yields rising on global cues, projecting a 6.55-6.85% range. Upadhyay anticipates a fiscal deficit of 4.2% and net borrowing of ₹11.6 trillion.

articles.summary: Samir Bodas co-founded Icertis, which reached unicorn status in 2019 and now operates across the US, Europe, Australia, and India.

articles.title: Eco survey: India Inc must expand footprint in times of trade uncertainties
articles.summary: India Inc needs to enhance internal capabilities and diversify risks by reducing single-market dependence. Strategic M A and partnership models are crucial for integrating into global value chains and navigating trade uncertainties. This approach will bolster resilience against external shocks and foster global competitiveness.

articles.title: Trade deals, diversification to strengthen exports momentum
articles.summary: India's export scene is on the rise! With promising trade negotiations underway with the United States and fresh partnerships forming around the globe, the outlook is remarkably optimistic. Even in the face of rising global protectionism, India's trade figures have outperformed projections. This acceleration is powered by significant structural reforms and strategic policy initiatives.

articles.title: Indian driver on student visa jailed in Australia for $200,000 real estate scam, impersonated law firm to defraud homebuyer
Manipulated images cause serious harm: Sridhar Vembu says AI labelling rules absolutely needed
articles.summary: Indian government’s move to mandate labelling of AI-generated content seeks to empower users to scrutinise such content and ensure that synthetic output is not masquerading as truth, IT Secretary S Krishnan had recently said at an event, and informed that the rules are now nearing finalisation.

articles.title: Paytm posts Rs 266 Cr profit in Q3 as it cuts key costs
articles.summary: Paytm kept revenue momentum intact while reining in costs, lifting operating revenue 20% to Rs 2,194 crore.

articles.title: Icertis cofounder Samir Bodas passes away
articles.summary: Samir Bodas, cofounder, and former CEO of enterprise software firm Icertis, has passed away after battling with cancer, the company said on Thursday.

articles.title: Economic Survey 2026 flags high distribution costs as key drag on insurance penetration
articles.summary: The Economic Survey 2025–26 warns high distribution costs are limiting India’s insurance growth, causing low penetration despite rising premiums and density, and urges digitisation to boost inclusion.

articles.title: Reforms may push growth rate to 7% in medium term: Economic Survey
articles.summary: India's economic growth potential has increased to 7 percent. This rise is attributed to ongoing reforms that are strengthening the nation's productive capacity. Further improvements in manufacturing and exports could boost growth even higher. The economy is set for steady growth amidst global challenges. Reforms in investment, infrastructure, and business ease are driving this positive outlook.

articles.title: Google to pay $135 million to settle Android data transfer lawsuit
articles.summary: A preliminary settlement with the Alphabet unit was filed late Tuesday night in the San Jose, California, federal court, and ‌requires a ‌judge's approval. Google denied wrongdoing in agreeing to the settlement, which covers users of Android-powered mobile ‌devices since November 12, 2017.

articles.title: Economic Survey calls for policies to promote flexible work to increase female workforce
articles.summary: India's Economic Survey 2025-26 reveals women face workplace hurdles like limited mobility and rigid schedules. It calls for flexible work, equal pay, and safety measures to boost female employment. Women spend more time on unpaid caregiving, impacting their paid work participation. Recent years show a rise in women joining the workforce and a drop in unemployment.

articles.title: Tighten oversight in the aviation sector
articles.summary: Wednesday’s incident is a reminder that India’s aviation sector has grown rapidly, but oversight hasn’t kept pace

articles.title: Noida couple dies after consuming poison, 3 children hospitalised, police cite family dispute
articles.summary: Police reportedly said that the couple consumed poison due to family-related issues and were rushed to the hospital

articles.title: Devastated UK family watches 5-year-old dying from rare childhood dementia; hundreds of seizures daily
articles.summary: Five-year-old Holly Nayler from Essex has CLN2 Batten disease, a rare and fatal form of childhood dementia that causes rapid neurological decline and frequent seizures. While an NHS-funded treatment cannot cure the condition, it has slowed the loss of her abilities. As access to the drug faces uncertainty, her family is calling for awareness and continued support.

articles.title: Wangchuk says he was misquoted, places speeches before SC
Karnataka police personnel to be granted leave on birthdays, anniversaries
articles.summary: Granting leave on these special days helps officers and staff rejuvenate emotionally, spend quality time with their families, and maintain a healthy balance between professional duties and personal life, the circular said.

articles.title: NCP in Catch-22: Ajit Pawar's 'last wish' and Mahayuti alliance; calls for Sunetra to step in
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar's sudden demise has plunged the NCP into a crisis, facing a potential merger with Sharad Pawar's faction and crucial decisions on alliances. The party grapples with leadership vacuum and cabinet representation, with Sunetra Pawar emerging as a potential successor to her husband's political legacy.

articles.title: SIP inflows jump seven-fold over past decade; household savings shift towards mutual funds: Economic Survey
articles.summary: Economic Survey 2025-26: SIPs boost mutual fund growth in India, assets reach ₹80 lakh crore, 5.9 crore investors shift savings to equities.

articles.title: PE and VC are overheating India's microfinance sector, Economic Survey warns
articles.summary: What began as a social mission to help the poor build assets and weather shocks has become a vehicle for chasing returns.

articles.title: CEA Nageswaran says Eco Survey 2026 highlights India as ‘an oasis of stability’ in an edgy world
articles.summary: V Anantha Nageswaran highlights India as an oasis of macro stability as reflected in the Economic Survey 2025–26, with strong growth, benign inflation, robust public finances and a resilient external sector.

articles.title: Apple warns memory costs are starting to bite as Samsung, SK Hynix prioritise AI chips
articles.summary: Apple will likely need more and ‌more memory chips as demand for its latest iPhone 17 has surged, especially in China and India. Cook called demand for the device in the December quarter "staggering," but declined to answer a question from an analyst on whether Apple might raise product pricing because of the paucity of memory chips.

articles.title: Quick commerce march trampling on ecommerce toes
articles.summary: India’s quick commerce grocery delivery is rapidly eating into ecommerce sales, which are being disrupted more than kirana stores. Quick commerce now accounts for nearly half of online grocery sales and is set to dominate two-thirds by 2030. Ecommerce firms are adapting, with many shifting towards quick commerce models.

articles.title: Is chip giant ASML about to hit a ceiling, or break through it?
articles.summary: ASML shares are up 34% so ‌far this month and ‌trade at 42 times 2026 earnings estimates, well above Nvidia's 25 times, as analysts have ratcheted up forecasts. ASML management sees sales growth this year ranging from as low ‌as 4% to as high as 19%.

articles.title: Banned to back again: A timeline of TikTok's rise, fall and rebirth
articles.summary: TikTok evolved from a teen dance app into a dominant US platform shaping culture, commerce and politics.

articles.title: Economic Survey 2025-26 for age bar for social media access, cutting online classes
articles.summary: India's Economic Survey 2025-26 highlights digital addiction as a growing concern. It proposes age-based online access limits and reduced online teaching. Schools will play a key role in digital wellness education. Simpler devices for children are recommended to prevent exposure to harmful content. The survey calls for comprehensive interventions to address the mental health impacts of digital addiction.

articles.title: Health beats motor as India's leading non-life insurance segment
articles.summary: India’s non-life insurance sector has seen strong growth, with health insurance surpassing motor as the largest segment, though overall coverage remains limited, the Economic Survey said. Rising premiums, healthcare costs, vehicle sales, and asset ownership are key drivers. Insurers are urged to digitise distribution and cut costs to improve penetration and market reach.

articles.title: Swiggy sees 20.5% YoY growth in food delivery order value
articles.summary: Food and grocery delivery platform Swiggy reported that its food gross order value (GOV) has accelerated, clocking 20.5% year-on-year (YoY) growth in the December quarter.

articles.title: Swiggy flags quick commerce growth impact from irrational competition, bulk order cannibalisation
articles.summary: Swiggy said fierce and often "irrational" competition slowed order growth at Instamart, especially for low average order value (AOV) segments. Losses widened as the company avoided deep discounts and low-margin volumes, despite strong growth in total order value. Swiggy prioritised sustainable demand over short-term gains, even as rivals cut prices aggressively.

articles.title: Info Edge inadvertently shares its unaudited draft financial results with an outsider
articles.summary: This follows a series of similar incidents. Earlier this month, Hatsun Agro Products told the stock exchanges that its draft unaudited December-quarter financials were accidentally posted on a senior executive’s personal WhatsApp status. Similarly, ICICI Lombard General Insurance said that its unaudited financial details for the December quarter were inadvertently shared on a senior employee’s WhatsApp status.

articles.title: Amazon layoffs: At least 500 employees in India will be hit, say sources
articles.summary: These job cuts, which are likely to increase in the coming days, are a part of the larger worldwide retrenchment of around 16,000 employees that Amazon is undertaking. “This time, the impact is less in India. About 500 people are affected, but this could go up to 800 in the coming days,” said a person close to the developments.

articles.title: Over 100 crore Indians online: Economic Survey says India a major data source
articles.summary: Calling data a “core factor of production” in the AI era, the Survey said India’s scale and digital diversity give it a strong advantage in developing AI-based applications and services.

articles.title: Nvidia, Microsoft, Amazon in talks to invest up to $60 billion in OpenAI: Report
articles.summary: This is the latest in multiple reports of the ChatGPT-maker raising big funds. Reports emerged last week about Altman raising about $50 billion from soverign funds in the Middle East at a valuation of $750-830 billion.

articles.title: Elon Musk's Neuralink says it has 21 participants enrolled in trials
articles.summary: This marks an ‌increase ‌from the 12 people the company in September said had ‌received its chips and were using them to control digital and physical tools through thought.

articles.title: SK Hynix aims for 'overwhelming' market share in next-generation HBM4 chips
articles.summary: It also added ‌that it aims to achieve the production ‍yields of HBM4 similar to ‍that ⁠of ⁠current-generation HBM3E chips.

articles.title: IBM beats fourth-quarter revenue estimates as AI clamor boosts software demand
articles.summary: Businesses have doubled down on upgrading their software suites to develop data-intensive artificial ‌intelligence technology, helping sales for IT service and software providers such as IBM.

articles.title: Meta boosts annual capex sharply on superintelligence push, shares surge
articles.summary: Shareholders backed CEO Mark Zuckerberg's ambitious capital outlay, boosting Meta stock 10% in extended trading, as the company posted a 24% surge in advertising revenue - its mainstay - for the quarter ended December 31. It also forecast first-quarter revenue above Wall Street expectations.

articles.title: Bumble, Match, Panera Bread and CrunchBase hit by cyberattacks: Report
articles.summary: Panera Bread ‌also confirmed ‌that an incident occurred and has alerted ‌authorities. "The data involved is contact information," it said in an emailed statement to Reuters.

articles.title: Microsoft capital spending jumps, cloud revenue fails to impress, shares drop after hours
articles.summary: On a conference call with ‌analysts, Microsoft executives tried to ‌persuade Wall Street to assess its success in AI by looking not only at its sales from selling cloud computing services, but also at its increasing business selling AI assistants of its own.

articles.title: ET Explains: Global push to restrict children's social media use
articles.summary: Children's mental health, excessive screen time, exposure to harmful content, and online abuse are concerns for governments. Studies show social media can affect mood, sleep and learning. So, many countries are looking for ways to protect minors.

articles.title: Pine Labs posts Rs 42 crore profit in December quarter; revenue rises 23% to Rs 744 crore
articles.summary: Operating revenue rose 23% to Rs 744 crore from Rs 601 crore a year earlier, driven by higher digital transaction volumes, value-added services linked to card payments, and affordability products. Growth in overseas markets also helped diversify revenue streams.

articles.title: Amazon cuts 16,000 jobs globally in broader restructuring
articles.summary: Reuters first reported ‌last ‍week that Amazon ‍was planning a second round ‌of job cuts as part of a broader goal of trimming about 30,000 corporate ‍roles, with the layoffs expected ‍to affect ⁠workers ⁠in Amazon Web Services, retail, Prime Video and human resources departments.

articles.title: Chip equipment maker ASML cuts nearly 4% of staff while trimming 1,700 jobs
articles.summary: Top computer chip equipment maker ASML logged ⁠record orders in the fourth quarter on Wednesday and boosted its 2026 outlook as demand surged from its AI-focused customers even as it trimmed 1,700 jobs.

articles.title: Formal skilling could boost jobs by 13%, says Economic Survey
articles.summary: India needs more formal skill training. The Economic Survey highlights this, suggesting a boost in skilled workers could significantly increase jobs. A unified apprenticeship mission is proposed, combining existing schemes. This aims to streamline training and attract more youth. Industry partnerships and policy reforms are key to building a future-ready workforce.

articles.title: Economic Survey turns bullish on growth, cautions on uncertainty: Aditi Nayar, ICRA
articles.summary: The revised potential growth estimate also anchors the survey's FY27 growth projection of 6.8-7.2%. It lays out three scenarios mapping global developments and the transmission of uncertainty to the Indian economy, a prudent approach given the scale of external volatility seen in 2025.

articles.title: Global Business Summit to discuss India’s path to a $10-trillion economy
articles.summary: New Delhi will host the ET NOW Global Business Summit 2026 on February 13-14. Policymakers and business leaders will discuss India's ambition to become a $10 trillion economy by 2047. The summit will focus on resilience and growth amidst global trade uncertainties. Discussions will cover strategic defence, semiconductors, clean energy, and digital sovereignty.

articles.title: Economic Survey: Pvt capital, climate tech key to fixing farm productivity
articles.summary: The challenges facing India's agriculture sector are significant, encompassing issues like fragmented land ownership and vulnerabilities to climate change. To combat these obstacles, the Economic Survey suggests innovative approaches such as adopting climate-smart farming practices and enhancing market connectivity for farmers. There's a crucial need for the private sector to step up in areas like food manufacturing and distribution.

articles.title: Economic Survey: Going green & orange, and in the pink of health
articles.summary: India's economy is poised for growth with proposed reforms. Opening heritage sites for concerts and easing artist visas will boost the concert economy. MSMEs will get better credit access. E-way bills will be simplified for smoother logistics. Dietary reforms are crucial for public health. Industrial clusters will be modernized. Commodity prices are expected to rise.

articles.title: Economic Survey flags strong growth ahead for India’s aviation, ports and shipping sectors by FY31
articles.summary: India's civil aviation and ports sectors are poised for substantial growth by FY31, fueled by increasing demand and infrastructure investments. The Economic Survey highlights India's low airport density compared to global benchmarks, indicating significant expansion potential. Ports are also scaling up, with PPP and captive operators expected to manage 80% of cargo by 2030.

articles.title: Manufacturing boost: Three cheers for 3-tier Swadeshi approach
articles.summary: India can boost domestic manufacturing in key sectors like oils, pulses, and pharmaceuticals. Other areas like battery cells and solar wafers need a gradual approach. The nation should focus on 'intelligent indigenisation' to build resilience and integrate globally. This strategy aims to strengthen manufacturing and lower costs. The focus is on strategic urgency, feasibility, and cost-effectiveness for long-term competitiveness.

articles.title: Food weight to decline to 36.75% in new CPI series
articles.summary: India's new Consumer Price Index series, effective February 12, will reduce food and beverage weight to 36.75% from 45.86%, reflecting evolving household spending. This shift aims to stabilize inflation readings and offer a more balanced monetary policy outlook. The revamped index also incorporates online market prices and rural housing rent for a comprehensive view.

articles.title: Economic Survey delivers powerful message of India's growth, say experts
articles.summary: India's Economic Survey 2025-26 projects robust growth of 6.8-7.2% amid global fragmentation, highlighting medium-term priorities like manufacturing and skill development. Experts view this as a strategic advantage, with potential GDP growth revised to 7% driven by capital expenditure and reforms. The survey emphasizes attracting global capital through faster execution and regulatory certainty.

articles.title: Growth, Gold, Swadeshi & Global risks: 10 signals from the Economic Survey 2026
India to cut food weighting in CPI in new inflation series
articles.summary: India is set to revise its inflation measurement, significantly reducing food's weight in the Consumer Price Index to 36.75%. This shift aims to stabilize inflation readings, impacting monetary policy. The updated basket will reflect current spending, incorporating rural rents and e-commerce prices for a more accurate economic picture.

articles.title: Facebook India net jumps 28% in FY25
articles.summary: Revenue from operations rose 25.0% to Rs 3,793 crore from Rs 3,035 crore a year earlier. Total income increased 25.2% to Rs 3,834 crore from Rs 3,064 crore. Total expenses for the year climbed 22.6% to Rs 2,881 crore, compared with Rs 2,350 crore in the previous fiscal. Employee benefit expenses jumped 36.3% to Rs 649 crore from Rs 476 crore.

articles.title: Google India net inches up in FY25
articles.summary: Net profit rose 0.8% to Rs 1,437 crore in FY25 from Rs 1,425 crore in the previous fiscal. Revenue from operations declined 3.2% to Rs 5,340 crore compared with Rs 5,518 crore a year earlier. Total income, however, increased 3.3% to Rs 6,116 crore from Rs 5,921 crore.

articles.title: An AI pioneer warns the tech 'herd' is marching into a dead end
articles.summary: AI pioneer Yann LeCun argues large language models are a dead end for achieving human-level intelligence. After leaving Meta, he criticizes Silicon Valley’s herd mentality, defends open source and pursues alternative AI systems that can plan, learn from the real world and rival global competitors.

articles.title: Hey, ChatGPT: Where should I go to college?
articles.summary: Overwhelmed parents and students increasingly use AI chatbots for college planning, research and reassurance. Tools offer constant, affordable guidance amid scarce counselors, but experts warn inaccuracies, flattery and outdated data can mislead applicants and cannot replace human judgment entirely reliably.

articles.title: Swiggy's loss widens; Economic Survey highlights
articles.summary: Food and grocery delivery platform Swiggy's losses widened in despite strong revenue growth. This and more in today's ETtech Top 5.

articles.title: Only 2% of Indian startups working on AI training data vs 40% in the US: Economic Survey
articles.summary: India lacks startups focused on organising AI training data, leaving much of its vast data potential unused, the Economic Survey says. It suggests India should avoid costly frontier models and instead build smaller, practical AI tools for specific sectors. This bottom-up approach could widen participation and strengthen India’s AI ecosystem.

articles.title: Nikhil Kamath invests $2.7 million in longevity startup Biopeak
articles.summary: Founded in 2025 by Rishi Pardal and Shiva Subramanian, Biopeak operates India's first specialised brand aimed at extending lifespans through preventive care. It opened a clinic in Bengaluru last year, and plans to open a second one in the coming month.

articles.title: Blue Machines AI sets new benchmark by engaging in unscripted hour-long debate on national TV
articles.summary: In a groundbreaking national television debut, Indian AI platform Blue Machines AI successfully engaged in a 60-minute unscripted news debate. This historic man-versus-machine contest showcased the AI's ability to handle complex discussions, interruptions, and rapid topic shifts, demonstrating enterprise-grade reliability and governance for India's burgeoning tech sector.

articles.title: MCX hikes gold, gold mini options strike intervals from ₹100 to ₹500
articles.summary: MCX revises Gold and Gold Mini options strike price intervals from ₹100 to ₹500 effective January 30.

articles.title: Merger of two NCPs was in offing, Ajit Pawar was keen on it
articles.summary: Ajit Pawar was set to merge both NCP factions soon, with Sharad Pawar and Supriya Sule in positive talks. His sudden death makes unity crucial for Baramati and Maharashtra.

articles.title: Services exports hit 10% of GDP, reinforce India’s external resilience: Economic Survey
articles.summary: Economic Survey 2026 highlights services exports as a key growth driver for India, with software and consulting leading, rising to 10% of GDP and boosted by global demand and trade agreements.

articles.title: India’s 7% growth outlook supports markets, but economists flag fiscal, trade, and currency risks
articles.summary: India’s near-7% growth outlook supports market sentiment, but economists caution that underlying sectoral fragilities, delayed trade risks and inflation-linked fiscal assumptions will remain key watchpoints for equities, bonds and the rupee.

articles.title: Indian economy shows steady momentum in December, says new monthly economy index by Moneycontrol
articles.summary: Moneycontrol’s Eco Pulse is a composite high-frequency index which aims to measure India’s economic momentum on a monthly basis and provide early signals of changes in the direction of GDP growth.

articles.title: Late to AI, but better placed: Economic Survey says India can skip the costly AI arms race
articles.summary: Its comparative advantage in the AI era, the Survey says, does not lie in building frontier-scale models. Instead, it lies in application-led innovation, the productive use of domestic data, the depth of human capital, and the ability of public institutions to coordinate distributed efforts across sectors.

articles.title: Economic Survey 2026 | FPIs dump equities, rotate into debt amid global risk-off
